intro: Piptostigma longepilosum var. subnudum, commonly known as the slender leaf palaquio, is a shrub native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and reduced leaves, which are typically smaller and less dense compared to the typical variety. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats. It is a member of the Rhamnaceae family and is known for its ecological importance in its native range. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
